page.title: 15YOUTH HOSTEL AT WILDERHOPE
page.content: Wilderhope Manor is owned by the National Trust but is leased to the Youth Hostel Association.On Wednesday & Saturday afternoons it is open for N.T.members to view it,non-members pay 80p.In it's role as a youth hostel the manor opens at 5pm. and closes at 10am next morning;it is open every day exept Sunday.Mainly schoolparties stay at this youth hostel and they come to the area for both holiday and study purposes.They visit places of interest and can then work in the field study centre provided;there is a small charge made for it's use.Camping is also permitted in the hostel grounds. By joining the Y.H.A.you receive a membership card which will admit you to youth hostels in over 50 countries. It is a cheap,unique way for young people to travel.
